::Shadow Wing::

She waited, ready to strike when the bot got near.  She scanned the 
area but couldn't get a reading.  She had snow piled up on her.  She 
was nervous.  She wondered if she could even take this bot who was 
following her. She heard footsteps in the snow.  The bot was getting 
closer.  Soon he would be right on top of her.  She held perfectly 
still.  She waited until he was right next to her.  She jumped up and 
aimed her gun right in his face. "HOLD IT YOU!..." she froze.  She 
saw Lunarpine standing there. "What in the Matrix are you doing 
here?"  



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> The snow had gotten worse, even though the hail had nearly stopped, 
> Lunarpine's senses were on full, his nose to the ground. most 
scents 
> were buried beneath the snow. He'd lost the predicons scent a while 
> back. The cold didn't bother him, being from the arctic north 
> helped. "A storm like this isn't normal anywhere." he thought, the 
> hot jungle below, would be destroyed by such a climate change.
> (Another temporal distortion perhaps.) Again he opened his comm 
only 
> to get static. His senses weren't reliable around here so he 
> transformed to bot and continued his search for Shadow Wing. For 
some reason he couldn't shake the fealing he was being watched.
